titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. Samuel Moore (alias Samuel Frazier), James Keenan, and Joseph Burgher, Indictment
CWG8620

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky January Term 1863
Jefferson Circuit Court January 15 1863
The Commonwealth Plff
versus Indict felony
Samuel Moore alias Samuel Frazier indicted with James Keenan and Joseph Burgher } Defts

The defendant Samuel Moore alias Samuel Frazier being solemnly called to appear in discharge of the recognzance entered into by him in this Court on the 6 day of January 1863, Came not but made default -- It is therefore considered by the Court that the Clerk of this Court issue a writ of scire facias against the said Samuel Moore alias Frazier together with U E Ewing his bail, to shew cause if any they have or can why the Commonwealth shall not have judgment and execution thereon against them for the sum of six hundred dollars each according to the form and effect of said recognizance and for a breach of the conditions thereof

A Copy Attest
James P Chambers c
Forfeiture remitted to Ewing the Bail

J F Robinson
$600. } Recog.
Enclose to Doct U E Ewing
Louisville
Issd April 18th 1863

Commonwealth
vs } Copy Recd
Samuel Moore
